metadata.title: CVE-2022-43680 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In libexpat through 2.4.9, there is a use-after free caused by overeagerdestruction of a shared DTD in XML_ExternalEntityParserCreate inout-of-memory situations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.8
libexpat1 - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-3ubuntu0.8').
xmlrpc-c package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
vnc4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libxmltok package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
